description: Explains concepts by specifically comparing them to a particular domain or field. This decorator forces analogies from a specified source domain to make complex or unfamiliar topics more relatable and understandable.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The specific domain, field, or context to draw analogies from

parameters.name: comprehensiveness
parameters.description: How comprehensively to map concepts between domains

parameters.name: mappings
parameters.description: Number of distinct concept mappings to create between domains

examples.description: Explaining a technical concept using sports analogies
examples.result: Explains blockchain technology by mapping concepts to sports analogies (e.g., ledger as scoreboard, miners as referees, consensus as rulebook)

examples.description: Detailed cooking analogy for complex scientific process
examples.usage:
+++ForcedAnalogy(source=cooking, comprehensiveness=detailed, mappings=5)
Describe how CRISPR gene editing works.
examples.result: Provides a detailed explanation of CRISPR through cooking analogies, with 5 distinct concept mappings (e.g., DNA as recipe, Cas9 as kitchen knife, guide RNA as cooking instructions)
